page.title: 03FARMS AROUND DIDCOT
page.content: Ladygrove is a small-holding of about 12 acres. Its Northern boundary is the parish boundary of Didcot itself. Mr Hiskins is unable to farm anymore since he hurt his back badly when he was lifting milk churns. Mount Ash Farm is owned by Mr Andrews. Apart from three peacocks, he has cattle, hens and geese. The farm is 100 years old. Keeping animals is more of a hobby to Mr Andrews, which is just as well, since he and Mrs Andrews are moving away in 1985. The land is to be built upon, as part of Didcot's major housing extension programme. One of the few dairy farms in the area is Field Farm. It has dairy cows, a bull, some hens and a few dogs. When the cows are ready to be milked, they are washed, but only if they are really dirty. After that their udders are sprayed just in case of any infection.
